definitions.text: (usually plural) valuables taken by violence (especially in war)
examples: to the victor belong the spoils of the enemy

definitions.text: the act of spoiling something by causing damage to it
examples: her spoiling my dress was deliberate

definitions.text: the act of stripping and taking by force
make a mess of, destroy or ruin
examples: I botched the dinner and we had to eat out
the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement

definitions.text: become unfit for consumption or use
examples: the meat must be eaten before it spoils

definitions.text: hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of
examples: What ultimately frustrated every challenger was Ruth's amazing September surge

definitions.text: have a strong desire or urge to do something
examples: She is itching to start the project
He is spoiling for a fight

definitions.text: destroy and strip of its possession
examples: The soldiers raped the beautiful country
